pull.title: Split MIN_PROTO_VERSION into INIT_PROTO_VERSION and MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION
pull.body:
INIT_PROTO_VERSION is the initial version, after a succesful version/verack it is increased to a negotiated version.
MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION could be a different value to disconnect from peers older than a specified version.

This commit alone does not change any behavior.  It stresses the difference between the initial and minimum version, the latter of which can be set to enforce a minimum version in a later policy discussion.

events.message:

INIT_PROTO_VERSION is the initial version, after a succesful version/verack it is increased to a negotiated version.
MIN_PEER_PROTO_VERSION could be a different value to disconnect from peers older than a specified version.

issue.title: fix problem with connection to 1.1.0 from 1.1.0.1
issue.body:
`MIN_PROTO_VERSION` is must less than `CADDR_TIME_VERSION`.
There is a problem with deserializing with `CAddress`, and it will be impossible to connect with the 1.1.0 clients.
I modified it based on bitcoin/bitcoin#3155.

issue.title: Question: PROTOCOL_VERSION vs INIT_PROTO_VERSION?
issue.body:
I've posted this twice on reddit (r/dogecoindev, r/coindev) but haven't gotten any responses :cry: :

So, version.h defines two constants, PROTOCOL_VERSION and INIT_PROTO_VERSION. PROTOCOL_VERSION seems self-explanatory, but for INIT_PROTO_VERSION there's a comment: "initial proto version, to be increased after version/verack negotiation". Does anybody know why that happens? What's the point of initially giving a bogus version then immediately changing it?

comments.body: It could be initialized to INIT_PROTO_VERSION for now.
Sure, but the different number stresses that it can be changed independently?  Your choice.
